books.author: by Maggie Haberman
books.description: The New York Times White House correspondent traces events from Donald Trump’s rise in New York City through to his post-presidency.
books.name: CONFIDENCE MAN

books.author: by Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.
books.name: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: by Kelly Ripa
books.description: The Daytime Emmy Award-winning TV host shares stories from her life on and off screen.
books.name: LIVE WIRE

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The conservative commentator’s Killing series profiles Elvis Presley, John Lennon and Muhammad Ali.
books.name: KILLING THE LEGENDS

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Scott Galloway
books.description: An overview of events from 1945 to the present and how they might inform potential crises in the near future.
books.name: ADRIFT

books.author: by Neil deGrasse Tyson
books.description: The astrophysicist and director of the Hayden Planetarium delves into subjects including politics, religion, gender and race.
books.name: STARRY MESSENGER

books.author: by Gabor Maté with Daniel Maté
books.description: The potential ways in which trauma and stress from modern-day living can affect our physical health.
books.name: THE MYTH OF NORMAL

books.author: by Peter Baker and Susan Glasser
books.description: The married journalists who write for The New York Times and The New Yorker posit that Donald Trump began to emulate the foreign autocrats he admired.
books.name: THE DIVIDER

books.author: by Nikki R. Haley
books.description: The former governor of South Carolina and U.S. ambassador to the United Nations shares her journey and profiles female leaders.
books.name: IF YOU WANT SOMETHING DONE

books.author: by Walt Bogdanich and Michael Forsythe
books.description: Investigative reporters for The New York Times examine the international consulting firm McKinsey & Company.
books.name: WHEN MCKINSEY COMES TO TOWN

books.author: by Nina Totenberg
books.description: The NPR legal affairs correspondent details her professional accomplishments and friendship with the late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.
books.name: DINNERS WITH RUTH

books.author: by Cody Keenan
books.description: The former speechwriter for President Obama recounts events that took place during 10 days in June 2015.
books.name: GRACE

books.author: by Randall Munroe
books.description: The creator of the web comic “xkcd” and former NASA roboticist looks into hypothetical and oddball scenarios.
books.name: WHAT IF? 2

books.author: by Buzz Bissinger
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist depicts the service of college football players who served in the Marines during World War II.
books.name: THE MOSQUITO BOWL
